name: Fine sediment balance
functionStatement: Balanced sediment supply and transport preserves bed elevations, substrate sizes, spawning/benthic habitats, and supports riparian succession.
descriptionMarkdown: Fine input aligns with transport, unless higher turbidity/fines are historically normal (e.g., blackwater).
howToMeasureMarkdown: Review available turbidity or TSS data and visually assess bed fines. Where data are absent, infer risk from land use and soils.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Substrate largely buried in fines. Chronic turbidity even at low flow.
Criteria: Embeddedness > 75% (Class 4) (Sylte & Fischenich 2002).

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Riffles partly blanketed in silt after storms. Fines persist for weeks.
Criteria: Embeddedness 50-75% (Class 3) (Sylte & Fischenich 2002).

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Some fines in pools and along margins. Riffles mostly clean.
Criteria: Embeddedness 25-50% (Class 2) (Sylte & Fischenich 2002).

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Gravel-cobble riffles with open voids. Thin or absent silt film.
Criteria: Embeddedness < 25% (Class 1) (Sylte & Fischenich 2002).
